description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

ExplanationOfBenefit.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

status.description: The status of the resource instance.

type.description: The category of claim, eg, oral, pharmacy, vision, insitutional, professional.

subType.description: A finer grained suite of claim subtype codes which may convey Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service. In the US the BillType.

billablePeriod.description: The billable period for which charges are being submitted.

created.description: The date when the EOB was created.

enterer.description: The person who created the explanation of benefit.

insurer.description: The insurer which is responsible for the explanation of benefit.

provider.description: The provider which is responsible for the claim.

organization.description: The provider which is responsible for the claim.

referral.description: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

facility.description: Facility where the services were provided.

claim.description: The business identifier for the instance: invoice number, claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

claimResponse.description: The business identifier for the instance: invoice number, claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

outcome.description: Processing outcome errror, partial or complete processing.

disposition.description: A description of the status of the adjudication.

related.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

prescription.description: Prescription to support the dispensing of Pharmacy or Vision products.

originalPrescription.description: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

payee.description: The party to be reimbursed for the services.

information.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues. Often there are mutiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

careTeam.description: The members of the team who provided the overall service as well as their role and whether responsible and qualifications.

diagnosis.description: Ordered list of patient diagnosis for which care is sought.

procedure.description: Ordered list of patient procedures performed to support the adjudication.

insurance.description: Financial instrument by which payment information for health care.

accident.description: An accident which resulted in the need for healthcare services.

employmentImpacted.description: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was precluded from working due to the treatable condition(s).

hospitalization.description: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was confined to a treatment center.

item.description: First tier of goods and services.

addItem.description: The first tier service adjudications for payor added services.

totalCost.description: The total cost of the services reported.

unallocDeductable.description: The amount of deductable applied which was not allocated to any particular service line.

totalBenefit.description: Total amount of benefit payable (Equal to sum of the Benefit amounts from all detail lines and additions less the Unallocated Deductable).

payment.description: Payment details for the claim if the claim has been paid.

form.description: The form to be used for printing the content.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Related.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

claim.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

reference.description: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains - eg Property/Casualy insurer claim # or Workers Compensation case # .

ExplanationOfBenefit_Payee.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

type.description: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

party.description: Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Information.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

sequence.description: Sequence of the information element which serves to provide a link.

category.description: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

code.description: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought which may influence the adjudication.

timingDate.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

timingPeriod.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

valueString.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

valueQuantity.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

valueAttachment.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

valueReference.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

reason.description: For example, provides the reason for: the additional stay, or missing tooth or any other situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

ExplanationOfBenefit_CareTeam.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

sequence.description: Sequence of careteam which serves to order and provide a link.

provider.description: The members of the team who provided the overall service.

responsible.description: The practitioner who is billing and responsible for the claimed services rendered to the patient.

role.description: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisiplinary team.

qualification.description: The qualification which is applicable for this service.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Diagnosis.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

sequence.description: Sequence of diagnosis which serves to provide a link.

type.description: The type of the Diagnosis, for example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

packageCode.description: The package billing code, for example DRG, based on the assigned grouping code system.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Procedure.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

sequence.description: Sequence of procedures which serves to order and provide a link.

date.description: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed .

ExplanationOfBenefit_Insurance.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

coverage.description: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

preAuthRef.description: A list of references from the Insurer to which these services pertain.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Accident.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

date.description: Date of an accident which these services are addressing.

type.description: Type of accident: work, auto, etc.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Item.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

careTeamLinkId.description: Careteam applicable for this service or product line.

diagnosisLinkId.description: Diagnosis applicable for this service or product line.

procedureLinkId.description: Procedures applicable for this service or product line.

informationLinkId.description: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information pplicable for this service or product line.

revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

service.description: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

modifier.description: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

programCode.description: For programs which require reson codes for the inclusion, covering, of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

servicedDate.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

servicedPeriod.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

quantity.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

unitPrice.description: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

net.description: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

udi.description: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

bodySite.description: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc).

subSite.description: A region or surface of the site, eg. limb region or tooth surface(s).

encounter.description: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

noteNumber.description: A list of note references to the notes provided below.

detail.description: Second tier of goods and services.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Adjudication.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

category.description: Code indicating: Co-Pay, deductable, elegible, benefit, tax, etc.

reason.description: Adjudication reason such as limit reached.

amount.description: Monitory amount associated with the code.

value.description: A non-monetary value for example a percentage. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Detail.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

type.description: The type of product or service.

revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

service.description: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

modifier.description: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

programCode.description: For programs which require reson codes for the inclusion, covering, of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

quantity.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

unitPrice.description: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

net.description: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

udi.description: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

noteNumber.description: A list of note references to the notes provided below.

subDetail.description: Third tier of goods and services.

ExplanationOfBenefit_SubDetail.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

type.description: The type of product or service.

revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

service.description: A code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI).

modifier.description: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

programCode.description: For programs which require reson codes for the inclusion, covering, of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

quantity.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

unitPrice.description: The fee for an addittional service or product or charge.

factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

net.description: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

udi.description: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

noteNumber.description: A list of note references to the notes provided below.

ExplanationOfBenefit_AddItem.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

sequenceLinkId.description: List of input service items which this service line is intended to replace.

revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

service.description: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

modifier.description: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

fee.description: The fee charged for the professional service or product.

noteNumber.description: A list of note references to the notes provided below.

detail.description: The second tier service adjudications for payor added services.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Detail1.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

service.description: A code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI).

modifier.description: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

fee.description: The fee charged for the professional service or product.

noteNumber.description: A list of note references to the notes provided below.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Payment.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

type.description: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the claim.

adjustment.description: Adjustment to the payment of this transaction which is not related to adjudication of this transaction.

ExplanationOfBenefit_ProcessNote.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

number.description: An integer associated with each note which may be referred to from each service line item.

language.description: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-EN" for England English.

ExplanationOfBenefit_BenefitBalance.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

category.description: Dental, Vision, Medical, Pharmacy, Rehab etc.

subCategory.description: Dental: basic, major, ortho; Vision exam, glasses, contacts; etc.

excluded.description: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicated the service is included in the coverage.

name.description: A short name or tag for the benefit, for example MED01, or DENT2.

description.description: A richer description of the benefit, for example 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but exclused Ortho, Implants and Costmetic services'.

term.description: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual vistis'.

ExplanationOfBenefit_Financial.description: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

Identifier.description: A technical identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously.

type.description: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

system.description: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

value.description: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

CodeableConcept.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

Reference.description: A reference from one resource to another.

reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

Period.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

Money.description: An amount of economic utility in some recognized currency.

Quantity.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

Attachment.description: For referring to data content defined in other formats.

contentType.description: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.

language.description: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.

data.description: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes. In XML, represented using base64.

url.description: An alternative location where the data can be accessed.

size.description: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).

hash.description: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.

title.description: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

creation.description: The date that the attachment was first created.

Coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

version.description: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

code.description: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

userSelected.description: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

Address.description: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats).  This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations which might not be valid for mail delivery.  There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world.

type.description: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.

text.description: A full text representation of the address.

line.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction,  P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

city.description: The name of the city, town, village or other community or delivery center.

district.description: The name of the administrative area (county).

state.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes).

postalCode.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

country.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

period.description: Time period when address was/is in use.
